content: The following lists events that happened during **1978 in Singapore**. ## Incumbents - [President](/wiki/President_of_Singapore): [Benjamin Henry Sheares](/wiki/Benjamin_Henry_Sheares) - [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore): [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) ## Events ### April - 25 April – Police national serviceman [Lee Kim Lai](/wiki/Lee_Kim_Lai) was murdered for his revolver by Ong Chin Hock, Yeo Ching Boon and Ong Hwee Kuan. En route to kidnapping him from his sentry post at [Mount Vernon](/wiki/Mount_Vernon,_Singapore), they also killed the taxi driver, Chew Theng Hin. ### October - 12 October – The [Spyros disaster](/wiki/Spyros_disaster) occurred at Jurong Shipyard, resulting in 76 fatalities. ### November - 10–11 November – Floods occurred in Singapore, leaving 2 fatalities. - 12–14 November – Then Senior Vice-Premier of the People's Republic of China [Deng Xiaoping](/wiki/Deng_Xiaoping) visits Singapore, setting the foundation for [China–Singapore relations](/wiki/China%E2%80%93Singapore_relations) before being formally established on 3 October 1990. The governments discussed regional security and Deng visited the [HDB](/wiki/Housing_and_Development_Board). ### December - 2–3 December – Another [flood](/wiki/1978_Singapore_flood) hit Singapore after about 512 millimetres (20.2 in) of rain fell in just 24 hours, causing 7 fatalities. - 6–10 December – [Evangelist](/wiki/Evangelism) [Billy Graham](/wiki/Billy_Graham) visits Singapore for a [crusade](/wiki/List_of_Billy_Graham%27s_crusades). ## Births - 13 February – [Desmond Choo](/wiki/Desmond_Choo), politician. - 23 July – [Stefanie Sun](/wiki/Stefanie_Sun), singer. - 24 September – [Jean Danker](/wiki/Jean_Danker), radio DJ. - 4 October – [Amrin Amin](/wiki/Amrin_Amin), politician. - 3 November – [Shaun Chen](/wiki/Shaun_Chen), actor. ## Deaths - 27 February – [Tan Teck Neo](/wiki/Tan_Teck_Neo), philanthropist and socialite (b. 1877). - 26 March – Chan Hock Wah, political detainee (b. 1932). - 16 April – [Abdul Hamid Jumat](/wiki/Abdul_Hamid_Jumat), former [Deputy Chief Minister of Singapore](/wiki/Chief_Minister_of_Singapore) (b. 1917). - 23 April – [Teo Soon Kim](/wiki/Teo_Soon_Kim), first woman admitted to the Straits Settlements bar (b. 1904). - 4 June – [Perumal Govindaswamy](/wiki/Perumal_Govindaswamy), MP for [Anson Constituency](/wiki/Anson_Constituency) (b. 1911). - 1 July – Lee Teck Him, former legislative assemblyman for [Tiong Bahru Constituency](/wiki/Tiong_Bahru_Constituency) (b. 1906). - 13 December – Thio Chan Bee, educationist and politician (b. 1904). title: 1978 in Singapore
